snippet: Mr. Sharon was both vilified and admired for his belief that Jews must assert and defend their collective needs without embarrassment or fear of censure.
abstract: Ariel Sharon, one of the most influential figures in Israel's history, dies at age 85; Sharon was a military commander and political leader who, at the height of his power, redrew the country's electoral map, only to suffer a severe stroke from which he never recovered.

byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Sharon was both vilified and admired for his belief that Jews must assert and defend their collective needs without embarrassment or fear of censure.

headline.sub: A Polarizing and Fierce Defender of Israel
headline.main: Ariel Sharon, Israeli Hawk Who Sought Peace on His Terms, Dies at 85
headline.print_headline: Ariel Sharon, Israeli Hawk Who Sought Peace on His Terms, Dies at 85
